title: Bladder Management — Protecting Renal Health
description: Understand neurogenic bladder types, catheterization options, and renal protection strategies. Practice troubleshooting and escalation.

screens.title: Neurogenic Bladder Types
screens.body: Neurogenic bladder can be reflex (spastic) or flaccid. Reflex bladder often requires intermittent catheterization, while flaccid bladder may need indwelling or suprapubic catheterization.

screens.back: Preferred for reflex bladder. Reduces infection risk and preserves renal function.

screens.question: Which catheter type is best for long-term flaccid bladder management?
screens.explanation: SPC is often preferred for long-term flaccid bladder management due to lower infection risk and easier care.

screens.prompt: Jamie presents with fever and cloudy urine after 2 weeks of IDC use.

options.result: Risk of infection increases. Consider alternatives.

options.text: Switch to CIC and educate on technique
options.result: CIC may reduce infection risk if feasible.
Correct — SPC may be indicated for recurrent infections.
